private_information: I am the left peg and currently hold the stack top->bottom: A, B, C, D
Disk A is the smallest, disk D is the largest
left_peg.goal: Move the full stack so that right peg has the stack top->bottom: A, B, C, D

private_information: I am the middle peg and currently hold no disks
middle_peg.goal: Move the full stack so that right peg has the stack top->bottom: A, B, C, D

private_information: I am the right peg and currently hold no disks
right_peg.goal: Move the full stack so that right peg has the stack top->bottom: A, B, C, D

orchestrator.goal: Produce a final PDDL domain and problem that solve the Tower of Hanoi instance for FastDownward, moving the stack from left to right following the rules

public_information: Three pegs named left, middle, and right.
Four disks labeled A (smallest), B, C, D (largest).
Initial configuration: left peg has disks top->bottom A, B, C, D; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: right peg has disks top->bottom A, B, C, D; left and middle pegs are empty.
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
You may never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.

state.system_prompt: You are an agent representing the left peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. Provide a concise factual report of your current local stack and any constraints you observe. Do not produce PDDL.
state.prompt: Agent name: left_peg. Use the public information about the environment and your private information to produce a short factual description of your local state, listing the disks you hold in order from top to bottom and any physical constraints relevant to moves. The global goal is that the right peg should hold the full stack A, B, C, D in that order. Do not generate PDDL, only a precise local state report.

state.system_prompt: You are an agent representing the middle peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. Provide a concise factual report of your current local stack and any constraints you observe. Do not produce PDDL.
state.prompt: Agent name: middle_peg. Use the public information about the environment and your private information to produce a short factual description of your local state, listing the disks you hold in order from top to bottom and any physical constraints relevant to moves. The global goal is that the right peg should hold the full stack A, B, C, D in that order. Do not generate PDDL, only a precise local state report.

state.system_prompt: You are an agent representing the right peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. Provide a concise factual report of your current local stack and any constraints you observe. Do not produce PDDL.
state.prompt: Agent name: right_peg. Use the public information about the environment and your private information to produce a short factual description of your local state, listing the disks you hold in order from top to bottom and any physical constraints relevant to moves. The global goal is that the right peg should hold the full stack A, B, C, D in that order. Do not generate PDDL, only a precise local state report.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL authoring targeting the FastDownward planner. Integrate the local state reports from the peg agents to produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance. The PDDL must model three pegs (left, middle, right), four disks labeled A B C D with A smallest and D largest, legal moves that move a single disk at a time, and the constraint that a larger disk may not be placed on a smaller disk. Produce a domain and a problem compatible with FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive concise factual state reports from the three peg agents. Use those reports together with the public information to build a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that solve the task: move the full stack from left to right following the rules. Ensure disks are named A B C D with correct size ordering, pegs are left middle right, initial state matches the agent reports, and the goal state has right peg with top->bottom A B C D. Target the FastDownward planner and keep the domain and problem clear and syntactically correct. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
